citations.narrative:
The temperature in the guinea pig housing facility near the wall heater was 60 degrees F or above, as measured with a
kestrel, but the temperature furthest from the heater was approximately 57.9 degrees F.
Guinea pigs kept in ambient temperatures that are too low may be subject to cold stress that may cause discomfort and
predispose them to developing other health issues.
The ambient temperature in indoor housing facilities for guinea pigs must not fall below 60 degrees F.

There was one guinea pig pen that did not provide the required amount of floor space. There were 51 weanling guinea
pigs housed in a pen that measured 24 by 96 inches or 2,304 square inches of floor space. Each weanling requires a
minimum of 60 square inches of floor space. Total floor space required to house these weanlings is 3,060 square inches.
There cannot be more than 38 weanling guinea pigs housed in an enclosure measuring 24 by 96 inches.
Inadequate space can cause stress, crowding, and aggression in animals.
The licensee must ensure that all guinea pigs are provided with the minimum amount of floor space in order to avoid
overcrowding and to support the health and well-being of the guinea pigs.
Correct by: March 28, 2023
This inspection and exit interview were conducted with the facility representative.
End Section
